ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 300
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail all! Here is a little trick in this same vain that some of the younger SongCasters may not know.. When you memorize a song, you have that You have not
ygData.messageBody:
Hail all!

Here is a little trick in this same vain that some of the younger
SongCasters may not know..

When you memorize a song, you have that 'You have not recovered' phase
that you can't USE the newly memeorized song until it 'pops' into view.
Start and stop any other song to cut that process short, thus making it
available immediately. Really helps when you are in a crunch and NEED that
song you just learned!

Frashii, Bard of the 21st Chord
Tarew Marr
Seekers of Lore, http://www.loreseekers.com

{SNIP}
> On a side note, I noticed something interesting last night. I died in
> Unrest, and was revived (LOVE that spell - saved me a ten minute walk
> back), and was nailed with the typical regeneration effects. This effect
> is supposed to prevent you from immediately being buffed and ready to
> charge - however, Bardic songs seem to be immune to this particular effect.
> I was able to sing all of my songs immediately afterwards, and suffered
> nothing except a massive loss of mana. Not that I use Mana.... ;)
>
> Talies the Wanderer
